posts.post_content: Correction, the thing making her very playable is jaya ballard who discards to your graveyard for use of one of 3 burn abilities. However, I still prefer the previous version, why? To use this one I have to stack my deck with enough of specific cards to make her ability count, and then she may never get to use it. Chandra nalaar only needs herself, has pretty solid abilities even if you don't use her ultimate, and her ultimate is still devastating. This one is good too, but its far more dependent on the lay out of a deck, much like nissa is, if you don't have any nissa's chosen for example.. well tough luck.

posts.post_content:
the only thing actually making her playable is [Pyromancer's Ascension](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Pyromancer's Ascension). at least you only need to keep her alive for 4 turns to win  
  
edit: yes [Jaya Ballard, Task Mage](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Jaya Ballard, Task Mage) is helpful to Chandra, but i was walking about her playability in limited and standard, where only the ascension can help her. i cant honestly see any truely good decks being made in Zendikar limited, its not a set designed to be played alone from what i have scene. there are a few gems, but most of them are just useless or weak. i mean, the best non-broken card i have scene is [Obsidian Fireheart](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Obsidian Fireheart). that isnt to say there arent good cards in the block, they are all just so easy to break decks with, expecially since the "land matters" theme of the block is obviously a strong indication of the best decks should be mono colored.  
  
Maybe a gimp to the cardpool because of Timespiral/Shadowmoor/Lorwyn standard? i know i have some devestating cards from those blocks, but... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

Posted By: lorendorky (12/4/2009 11:44:38 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: Pretty nifty in limited where you can have trouble getting 'enough' spot removal. Turning any red card into a 4 damage burn can help finish off the opponent or clear the board of their creatures. Generally her major won't be quite effective due to having very few sorceries and instants, but her second ability is also great - discard/play cards til you've got nothing, then force your opponent to discard and get 3 cards yourself for your trouble (of course, it might be advantageous to not do this if your opponent has less than 3 cards themselves and you're in a dominant position).
posts.html:
Pretty nifty in limited where you can have trouble getting 'enough' spot removal. Turning any red card into a 4 damage burn can help finish off the opponent or clear the board of their creatures. Generally her major won't be quite effective due to having very few sorceries and instants, but her second ability is also great - discard/play cards til you've got nothing, then force your opponent to discard and get 3 cards yourself for your trouble (of course, it might be advantageous to not do this if your opponent has less than 3 cards themselves and you're in a dominant position).

posts.post_content:
I dont see why everyone says she is as good as they are saying. I feel she should be one less mana to play and to compromise 1 loyalty counter to do that if need be. But she is not good in burn decks. There is no point, you can just use your cards as themselves, and in a normal burn deck, by the time you get her out, there is no point anymore.   
her second ability is great because it can screw your opponent and help you or just give draw 3 for you.  
her 3rd ability i admit is a POWER in a burn deck or similar decks that use lots of sorcery's or instants that can be useful later on in the game.  
but the first ability is useless. you can play the burn spells as burn spells, and by the time she is out, you want to finish your opponent off, not play her, in a burn deck.  
Chandra is good in a normal deck that if its later in the game, you discard any kind of cards that normally wouldn't burn, and you make them burn spells. and change the way your deck works in a tight spot.

Posted By: PeterRabit (11/4/2009 11:04:14 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
10/1/2009 - "If the creature targeted by the first ability is an illegal target by the time it resolves, the entire ability is countered. You won't discard a card." - nice that you don't have to discard a card if this ability is countered  
  
@Starkwolf fireball won't work with her ability since its activation costs will become 0 thus dealing 0 damage. For casting fireball from the graveyard you must use something like [Yawgmoth's Agenda](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Yawgmoth's Agenda) or [Yawgmoth's Will](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Yawgmoth's Will) and pay its cost regularly
